reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location if you want to be near RMSP. Very quiet. Bed a bit hard and uncomfortable and light streams in the small window that faces the highway.
reviews.title: Quiuet, peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our fourth visit to the Deer Crest. This lovely place, which is a five minute drive to downtown Estes Park and a five minute drive to the entrance of Rocky Mountain National Park, is owned and managed by Carrie and Ken. They and their staff members are friendly, efficient, and seem to go out of their way to make you feel "right at home."
reviews.title: Peaceful and Relaxing Atmosphere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Setting:
reviews.title: Always Wonderful"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tranquility and serenity are the words that come to mind when describing the setting of the Deer Crest. This lovely property is surrounded by pine trees and aspens and is situated along the banks of the Fall River. Lawn chairs, picnic tables, swings, and barbecues are sprinkled across the the beautiful landscape of lawns and gardens.
reviews.title: We loved it and would return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rooms:
reviews.title: Peaceful and Relaxing grounds by the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room 207 is very nice, has a big king bed and a great balcony as well.
reviews.title: Beautiful stay

reviews.text: Rooms are clean and does the job well !
reviews.title: Beautiful spot, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No breakfast but there are a fridge and microwave in the room.
reviews.title: Brilliant! Our second visit.

reviews.text: The place is very cozy and quiet next besides the river. Its about a mile from the village, and a tiny bit away from the small main road to the national park.
reviews.title: My favorite accommodations in Estes Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To the entrance of the park its only a 4 minutes drive.
reviews.title: Getting away to celebrate my 63rd birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in the Fall River suite for five nights, first time to Estes Park and RMNP. This location and resort were all we could hope for. Simple, clean, spacious resort in a great location to both Fall River and main gateway to RMNP, as well as town of Estes itself. Some mentioned walking into town from here, definietly doable, approx a mile or so, but I'll save my hiking for the park though.
reviews.title: Dear Memories of Deer Crest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fall River Suite was on river side (which was wonderful to listen to both morning and night) we stayed during late August so windows were wide open. This room was steps to pool (very clean and not used much as all other than me!) and the indoor hot tub (plenty of pool towels provided in here). Outdoor bench and small outdoor chairs and table facing river, just you, cup of coffee and the resident marmot.
reviews.title: Beautiful Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort itself was very quiet, most guests 40 and older, so it was nice after days of hiking to come back to peace and quiet of the rushing river only.
reviews.title: We'll be back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fall River Suite was one very large open style room. It was spacious, with large kitchen area with stove top, microwave, toaster, coffeemaker, kitchen suppiles (very adequate), full refer also. Note there is not oven at all (glad we remembered that (in what is a large kitchen) before we bought that pre-made pizza to bake from the supermarket in town!). Full counter in kitchen, with two counter chairs. Large king bed (comfortable) and two person love seat in open area with one wall a large stone gas fireplace. Good amount of drawer space in bureau/entertainment center. There is a seperate sink area outside of the bath that shares space with an "open" closet/luggage area. Good amount of space here to operate in mornings etc. Bath is smaller with bath/shower combo, but very adequate - usual size like bath's used to be before they got huge as so many are built now. Plenty of towels, decent quality.
reviews.title: Great stay once again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was excellent and decoratng was very home spun, keeping with the nature theme of the area. It was really comfortable, felt like the family resorts of yesteryear, so we really enjoyed that spirit while being surrounded by the awesome Rockies.
reviews.title: Spotless cleanliness and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our 3 night stay here very much. Our room on the second floor was large with a king bed, reclining love seat and chair. Very clean. The grounds are well manicured with plenty of seating next to Fall River so you can just relax and enjoy being outside. We also enjoyed our balcony with the table and chairs. It was a great place to watch the many hummingbirds right by the table as we munched on cheese and crackers with a glass of wine. One afternoon we even saw a small black bear run across the grounds -- wish I would have had my camera ready! The resident marmot is also pretty entertaining. The staff is very pleasant and we wanted for nothing. The location is great, close to Rocky Mountain Natl. Park on one side and only about a mile out of Estes on the other. Estes can get pretty congested with traffic so staying a little out of town is really refreshing. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: So quiet and relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I are on a 9 day trip in Colorado, and only stayed one night at Deer Crest Resort so that we could see Rocky Mountain National Park. Despite the 2-night minimum stay on the online reservation, we emailed the owners and they were able to accomodate us for 1 night. Most accomodations in the area are for small families at over $200/night so Deer Crest was a much more affordable option for just the 2 of us. The location was pretty good because it was just a short drive back to the downtown area or along the way to the Trail Ridge entrance of RMNP. The room was large, clean, and well-maintained, however, it was rather dated in my opinion. It has the same toiletries as you'd expect from a hotel. In fact, I'm staying at a Sheraton as I'm writing this review, paying much more per night, and the Sheraton does not provide any more than what we had at Deer Crest.
reviews.title: Peaceful, cozy, clean motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room did not have an air-conditioner, but it was okay because there was a ceiling fan and it was actually a little cool at night even in August. The room comes with a small microwave and fridge which would have been really useful if we stayed a few more nights and got to use the BBQ on the beautiful green lawn alongside the river. Sitting by the river was so peaceful.
reviews.title: Best resort in town
peaceful and green
reviews.text: The only complaint that I had was that the towels were starting to show its age and wasn't very absorbant.

We stayed two nights and it was so pleasant and relaxing. The room was large, very clean and the only sounds at night, if you opened the window, was the river flowing below the large beautiful lawn. We look forward to visiting here again.
reviews.title: Deer Crest is an excellent choice in Estes Park
